Daily tooling

These are the languages, platforms, and workflows I reach for when shipping resilient systems.

Languages

Rust, Python, and TypeScript for most builds. C++ when performance demands it.

Platform

k3s + GitOps for homelab infrastructure, Argo CD app-of-apps, Longhorn for storage.

Tooling

Neovim, tmux, and a heavily customized terminal workflow, all running on self-hosted services.

Observability

Grafana, Prometheus, and log pipelines on deck as HA improvements land.

About this site

The portfolio is being rebuilt to share a consistent design language while staying Rust-first at runtime.

The redesign uses Astro for component-driven pages and markdown-backed content collections, while my Rust backend keeps serving requests and WebAssembly demos. Legacy pages remain available during the migration for reference.

Tokens, layout primitives, and reusable cards keep each page consistent. When a new project ships, I only need to update the content collectionâ€”the UI adapts automatically.
